name: places/ChIJASP7CaRZwokRRZYWATL8lkg
adrFormatAddress: 182 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA

editorialSummary.text: Popular studio featuring Bikram yoga & heated HIIT classes in a down-to-earth atmosphere.

originalText.text: The best yoga studio I’ve been to. I’ve been to tons of yoga studios over the last 11 years. This is by far my favorite yoga studio I’ve practiced bikram yoga at. Great if you’re traveling. They’re very accommodating, they loaned me a lock, yoga towels, they have great showers with body wash, shampoo,conditioner, hair dryers and plenty of lockers and space to change. The drinks are not over priced like most studios. Check in is on the 3rd floor. I had a great check in experience with Cyan he was really kind, friendly and helpful. Bonus appreciation when he called me because I forgot some of my things. He’s a lovely person with the perfect personality for yogis. Mark Far’s evening 90 minute class was difficult but in a very good way. As a traveler he all warned me it’s hot. It’s a bit warmer temperature than the studios at home. Mark knew when to suggest encouraging to keep going and when to offer support when he saw me struggling. He’s kind, extremely knowledgeable with a really fun vibe. Lindsay’s 75 minutes morning class over looking Fifth Ave lovely she’s a vibe, totally fan girling over her. She’s also very kind, encouraging, knowledgeable with a fun vibe. Both instructors have amazing personalities. They both made me smile several times through my difficult journey. The students are as amazing and kind as the staff. They made me feel extremely welcome. I wish I had more time to practice with them. I wish I could bring this place home with me. If you’re new to this practice, or like me traveling in from out of town. Check in early, the trick is to get a spot by the window or door. Trust the processes and the instructors they know what they’re doing. This place is magical, I highly recommend coming here. I will be back on my future travels.

originalText.text:
Very happily took a couple of classes. Excellent instructors!
The place could be cleaner though especially the changing area and benefit from a reno (a few touches could do wonders here) but I guess as rent is insane in NYC and is hard for studios to survive.
Heat is a bit inconsistent. Studio is not smelly which is nice.
I appreciated shampoo, conditioner and shower gel being provided.

originalText.text:
They keep the place clean and they teach excellent 90 minute hot classes which are becoming a rare species in NY as most people's attenion spans continue to shrivel

What more can you really ask for?? I am so grateful this place exists and for the entire staff that keeps it running and all of the teachers who sweat their brains out day after day teaching yoga that works your mind body and soul

Been with them since 2016 still learning something new from every class, love it, 5 stars

originalText.text: Eric is a whole vibe. The HIIT class is very hot and very challenging. Showers, lockers available. Mats available to rent. Recommend bringing extra clothes because you will sweat. Will be returning

text.text: Eric is a whole vibe. The HIIT class is very hot and very challenging. Showers, lockers available. Mats available to rent. Recommend bringing extra clothes because you will sweat. Will be returning

originalText.text: I have been doing Bikram for 12 years and of having done it for so long you can imagine that I really enjoy the heat. I do not enjoy it here. The heat level in this studio is insane. I have never seen so many yogis sitting down on their mats for such long periods. I myself have not had to sit during a class in years . Yesterday I lost out on half the class when I felt the need to sit. I do not understand the theory behind this. It is so hot that the floor itself is like beach sand on a 95 degree day. I cannot imaging how many people try it out and after the first day do not return. On top of everything I think it is bad business model. If twelve years ago this studio had been my first experience I would not have continued. Trust me if the room was 5-7 degrees cooler the  workout would still be great and everyone would be still soaked with sweat. I will finish out my ten pass and then have to strongly consider another studio.
